plot_data.py - create scatter plot from tabular data¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

Purpose¶

This scripts creates a scatter plot from tabular data.

Reads data in tabular format with observations in rows in different samples in columns. The first column provides the bins.

Reads data from stdin unless infile is given.

Usage¶

Example:

python plot_data.py --help

Type:

python plot_data.py --help

for command line help.

Command line options¶

Usage: plot_data.py [options]

Options:
  --version             show program's version number and exit
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --no-usage            output help without usage information
  -f FILENAMES, --file=FILENAMES
                        files[s] to take data from,stdin = -.
  -l LEGEND, --legend=LEGEND
                        legend for plot. If not given, the legend is build
                        from the column titles [default=%Default].
  --no-legend           do not output a legend [default=%Default]
  -t TITLE, --title=TITLE
                        title for plot.
  -p FILE, --hardcopy=FILE
                        filename for hardcopy.
  --xrange=XRANGE       xrange.
  --yrange=YRANGE       yrange.
  -o LOGSCALE, --logscale=LOGSCALE
                        log-transform one or both axes [default=%Default].
  -x XTITLE, --xtitle=XTITLE
                        title for x axis
  -y YTITLE, --ytitle=YTITLE
                        title for y axis
  -n, --normalize       normalize histograms
  --legend-location=LEGEND_LOCATION
                        location of legend
  --backend=BACKEND     backend to use [Agg|SVG|PS]
  --symbols=SYMBOLS     symbols to use for each histogram [steps|...].
  --dump                dump data for debug purposes.
  -c COLUMNS, --columns=COLUMNS
                        columns to use for plotting [default=%Default].
  --color=COLOR, --colour=COLOR
                        column with field to use for coloring
                        [default=%Default].
  --transpose           transpose values (swop x and y axis).
  --truncate            truncate histogram before plotting to xrange.
  --layout=LAYOUT       layout.
  --scatter             do a scatter plot.
  --point-size=POINT_SIZE
                        point-size.
  --add-function=FUNCTION
                        add a function to the plot.
  --add-error-bars=ERROR_BARS
                        add error bars.
  --no-titles           no column titles given.
  --palette=PALETTE     colour palette [default=%Default]
  --reverse-palette     reverse colour palette [default=%Default].
  -v LOGLEVEL, --verbose=LOGLEVEL
                        loglevel [1]. The higher, the more output.
  --timeit=TIMEIT_FILE  store timeing information in file [none].
  --timeit-name=TIMEIT_NAME
                        name in timing file for this class of jobs [all].
  --timeit-header       add header for timing information [none].
  --random-seed=RANDOM_SEED
                        random seed to initialize number generator with
                        [none].
  -I FILE, --stdin=FILE
                        file to read stdin from [default = stdin].
  -L FILE, --log=FILE   file with logging information [default = stdout].
  -E FILE, --error=FILE
                        file with error information [default = stderr].
  -S FILE, --stdout=FILE
                        file where output is to go [default = stdout].
